reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2013
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lovely design, sturdy, easy to maintain
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I have to say that I am impressed by this fountain. This fountain was purchased to replace a cheaper one that didn't last long. I am using it as both a decoration and a cat fountain for my spoiled cats.Look: The material the base is made from doesn't look spectacular or stand out as a centerpiece but it's passable. I prefer how it looks without the light plugged in, as it has a simple elegance. The water does pour from each of the four spouts evenly and I added a slab of green goldstone at the base to change the sound and add some glimmer. I had been hoping the base would be open to be filled with stones but it is solid. That was a downfall at first until I realized how helpful that would be for maintenance, since it keeps out the cat hair and other debris that the previous fountain accumulated.Sound: It's loud enough with the goldstone that I can hear the tinkle in the next room with the heater on. Without the goldstone it's pretty quiet but it comes with some pebbles that you can place on the wire at the top of the base to catch the water and make it louder.Pump: Water pressure is good and the pump is the same type of pump I've seen in every other fountain, so cleaning it is a breeze. It plugs into a pretty tight tube which keeps the pressure straight up to the ball part. Without the ball there, the pressure is high enough to make a bit of a mess so turn it off before you clean it!Power: There is no on/off switch, so you have to unplug it. However, for the lights, you can simply unplug the lights from the pump. They otherwise join for the main power source and there's only one plug required for the whole fountain, which was a concern I had had before purchase since I only have enough room for one outlet.Lights: When the lights are on, it is ridiculously fun to watch but also sort of tacky. It has three colored lights below the ball: red, blue, and green. When they are lit, it looks sort of like a disco ball. I hope to add a video of this. Also, the wiring for the lights seems safer than some fountains and I doubt I would damage the wiring during regular maintenance, as has happened on some fountains with lights. Plus, the lights can be unplugged from the power supply. As far as safety, that's a plus!Ball: The ball, on its own, is really nothing special. I dropped it while taking it out of the box and it survived, so that's good. I did notice once that it had stopped spinning, though when I pushed it, the ball began and sped right back up.Maintenance: Pretty standard care for fountains. Use distilled water if you can. The hardest spots to clean are the tube and pump. If you've cleaned pumps before, it's no different. The tube is short enough that cotton swabs should be sufficient. I haven't had it long enough to see how it reacts to mineral buildup but I imagine it won't look so elegant due to the dark color but the water is also fairly limited to a couple areas, not all of which are visible, so I'm not worried.Splash: None!! Previous fountains have left messes from splashes but this one, as long as the ball is in place, does not splash outside of the fountain!Price: It is a bit expensive for a table fountain but well worth it as long as it lasts. The price is actually comparable to cat fountains but this looks better and is just as simple to clean and does not require filters. The bigger cost is ongoing distilled water.Overall: This fountain seems sturdy and simple. I like the sound and it's easy to adjust the sound when I get sick of it. The light is pretty great for when kids visit or when I need sensory regulation but I otherwise leave it unplugged.I will probably purchase another in a month or two for the other side of the counter. If you're on the fence between this and one of the cheaper fountains, go with this fountain. It'll last longer.EDIT: Added a short video just so you can see what it looks like with light and without the light, as well as seeing it from multiple angles.Another edit to add that I've found maintenance to be very easy and actually, any lime buildup it may be getting doesn't seem to be very noticeable, though I am using distilled water for the most part. My cat loves it and drinks off of the ball part, which is adorable. If I knew how to upload a second video, I would!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2013
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Tabletop Fountain
reviewText: This tabletop fountain looks great on a small table or desk. It is easy to clean, and works great. I only use distilled water in the fountain, since regular tap water can leave behind mineral build-up and clog the pump. The fountain also looks great in the dark as the light dances across the surrounding walls and ceiling in multiple colors, especially shades of greens, blues, and reds. If you want an especially loud fountain, then you might look elsewhere as it is not excessively loud. It does put out enough sound, depending on how the rocks are arranged, to relax me when I'm in the same room with it running. I would definitely purchase this fountain again if I ever needed another one. Once again, I strongly recommend using only distilled water in it, and changing the water once a month to keep it performing great.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2020
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars I read reviews and decided to buy; here's why.
reviewText: I read many reviews before deciding to buy. Several mentioned that it splashed a lot. I almost didn't buy it because of that. But some of those who said that used a rock or pebble to assist with the flow and prevent splashing. Okay, potential problem solved. Several others mentioned that the pump was loud. Again, I considered not buying. But then I read responses that said to make sure the pump is completely submerged. Okay, another potential problem solved. I didn't find any other issues mentioned (other than the water tasting bad, but I'm not buying it to drink or for an animal to drink so....) so I decided to buy it. It's lovely! It produces a wonderful visual effect. My pump speed is at the highest and it trickles nicely. Doesn't splash at all. The pump makes a light hum, but it's not annoying. It is fully submerged. It shipped quickly and was easy to set up. My only disappointment is that it does not produce sound of water I was hoping for.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2018
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quiet and inexpensive fountain
reviewText: **Update**Well, it lasted me 3 years, today it died. I think the inside was clogged, even after cleaning the bowl and the base the water just trickled up to the top and barely made its way back down. Not too bad for the price honestly, I thought it would have died much sooner.**************I think this is a very nice water fountain for the price. I followed the recommendation of some other reviewers and added river stones to the base. It just enhances the look. I also made sure to suction the pump to the bottom of the base before adding water, and I have the pump set on the lowest setting. I have no issues with splashing, vibrations, or sounds from the pump. It really does need to be filled all the way to the top of the bowl to keep the pump completely submerged. I have it set on my desk at work, on a fake stone pad. Even after running it all week, 8 hours per day, I have not yet needed to fill it with water. I think if you fill it properly and set it on a base, you should not have any problems with vibration of the motor or any unnecessary sounds. This fountain is silent and very pretty.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2018
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Careful buying used, good condition with minor imperfections. They are major. Craftsmanship also not consistent between buyers.
reviewText: UPDATE 2: I had to come back and lower my rating to 1 star. This is ridiculous. We've all seen the $9.99 table fountains at Walgreens that are cheaply made and don't seem to last. But at least they don't splatter all over. This fountain is no better and just as cheaply made. It's motor is exactly the same as a $10 fountain too. I am so sick of the splatters this fountain leaves all over my table every time I use this. I posted another picture to show you what happens after just three minutes of use. It's cheaply made and I would expect a LOT more paying 4 times the price. This is worth no more than $10, and had it been priced where it belongs, it would have gotten 3-4 stars. If you get what you pay for then this fountain is a scam.ORIGINAL REVIEW: (Update #1 is after this.) I hope to return and update this review to 5 stars. Beware buying ‚Äúused‚Äù with only minor imperfections. The one I received had MAJOR imperfections making the fountain completely unusable. Ever. I‚Äôve included pictures. Compared to the other reviewer pictures, you can see the drastic difference. Mine had the fountain top leaves installed way too close to the front edge where the water is supposed to spill off onto the base/rocks. Mine spills right onto the flared edge and splashes the water all over the table. Ironically, I purchased this fountain to replace another defective one I bought at the store, which splashed water everywhere but into the reservoir. It also had a defective bottom on the inside reservoir with a grainy finish that prevents the pump‚Äôs suction cups from adhering at all, even when moist. I used to be able to trust Good Condition to Like New, but lately everything is very poor condition to unusable, like this fountain. And I only saved a measily few dollars. Something like this one needs major repairs and resoldering to be usable, so it should be sold for 1/4 the price, honestly revealing its need to be fixed. I just reordered a new one and when I receive that I will update this review with its quality and performance.UPDATE: I received the new one just a few days later. This is brand new, not used from Amazon Warehouse. It is a little bit better, however the suction cups still do not stick properly to the bottom as the instructions require and explain how to do it. The bottom is too rough of a surface to stick, with or without wetting the suction cups. The instructions say to get rid of the vibration noises, to make sure the suction cups are adhered securely to the bottom of the reservoir. We can't, it won't stick. In addition, the hose attachment coming out of the fountain top that attaches to the pump is at an odd angle that won't let the pump sit flat, but pushes it up on one side. The hose should be straight down, perpendicular to the bottom of reservoir to control vibration, but it is not. It is at a 30 degree angle and not possible to bend/reposition. Therefore, our new fountain has a significant audible vibration sound that cannot be fixed, and can be annoying when you just want to hear the sweet sound of the running water. The fountain top leaves that pour into the rocks below (rocks not included,) are now mounted further back from the edge than the first one as my new image shows, but it is still mounted a bit too close to the edge, and after 20 minutes of use my table was significantly dotted with splashes of water all around the front and sides of the fountain extending out at least 3-4", which annoys me. I'm going to see if my husband can unscrew the fountain top and reattach it properly, far enough away from the edge as is possible and rotated to sit all the way back near the edge opposite the lowest water leaf side. and out of the way of the pump cord - to avoid the splatters. It should not be a problem if we have a set of holes under the fountain top from the previous screwed placement. This should prevent splashing on my table, I think. If not, I will be contacting the company to complain about quality of craftsmanship not being consistent between buyers because images from other reviewers show a much better attached fountain top. Two purchases having the same problem should not happen.

reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Adorable elephants but lacks soothing sound of water
reviewText: I'm a little disappointed with this fountain. It comes with two water flows that you can change with the switch on the pump. Keep it on the low setting because the high setting will splash water outside of the bowl. I tried it on high, adjusting water levels and position of the elephants, but it always ended up with splashing water. I filled the water to the recommended level and even placed a thin sponge in the base. This reduced the vibration sound but I continue to hear the pump rather than the sound of trickling water. The fountain does look cute. I added some rocks in the bowl to give it a nicer appearance and some weight. My clients seem to enjoy the appearance of it but I just wish that I could hear the water rather than the pump. Kind of bummed out. The seller did send the fountain in great condition and in good time. They were very quick to answer my questions and generously offered to resolve the issue.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2015
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Unique design, I'm happy with it!
reviewText: This fountain is a bit smaller than I'd initially thought it would be, however it is a very unique piece and I'm very happy with my purchase. It does resemble the natural stone look which makes it appealing. I did find that it must be filled completely with water up to the top as the pump requires that due to the way it sits, but it was not an issue. You just need to make sure you keep the water level up for it to properly function. I turned up the pump so it has a heavier flow of water circulating. The pump and sound of water is quiet, there is relatively no noise and not much of a water sound but enough that this piece still attracts attention as a conversation piece due to the design of it. The pump is small, I don't know how long it will last but the bowl underneath is large enough that I have another small fountain pump I believe will work if I must replace at some point. Set up was as simple as attaching the pump and filling it with water. You should be aware that there is no off switch on the cord and it has no lighting as some other fountains do. I believe those would have been attractive features to have incorporated for this fountain but I still am enjoying it anyway. It does not have an annoying water trickling sound which is nice, everyone has commented on liking the design and is surprised it is not made of stone as it appears like a heavy piece. I feel it's adequate to the price I paid and the functionality of it has been fine for a small desk sized indoor fountain. I use it in my office and I think it's a nice feature for that purpose as it doesn't leak water or splash out.

Then, since it's so small, the water splashes out of the unit - enough that I have to place something all around the fountain to absorb the splash. Would return but as I said, like the design. Not worth the effort.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2016
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good fountain, great operation! Adjustable flow on pump.
reviewText: The first one I received was damaged and after contacting the seller a replacement was shipped before I even had a chance to drop this one off at the UPS store. The fountain pumpMakes a little noise but it is hardly noticeable. I'm using it in my chameleon terrarium and have been running it 24hrs a day 7 days a week with no problems. The flow can be adjusted with a small tab on the pump. I am using water from my well to fill it and have not had any trouble. The chameleon gets some moss and crickets in the water from time to time, this has not affected the performance and I clean the fountains water reserve every 2 weeks or so. It is made from a resin like material that will break if you drop it so be careful when moving or cleaning it. The fountain looks great and I am very happy with it. It is small but that is perfect for what I am using it for. It would look nice on a desk and not take up much space.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful Sound & Zen-like Elegance
reviewText: I have had numerous fountains over the years - some far more expensive than this little beauty. No fountain has had such a perfect sound as this! As you can see, it's become part of a vignette that has yet to fill in. The simplicity of this piece, as well as its rather petite size, make it perfect for such an undertaking, though it is elegant on its own.One of my favorite characteristics of this fountain is the large bowl. Even in the dry air of Tucson, I don't need to top it off more than once every three to four days. I've never run it until the motor - the blessedly silent motor - was exposed.I do add algaecide to the gallon of distilled water from which I fill it. I love that there are no mineral spots nor any sign of algae after a solid month of running. I'm only halfway through the gallon from which I filled the fountain! I mention this because it's rather astounding that I've run it for a month and have any of the original gallon jug left, let alone a full half!But what matters most about any fountain? The sound. With this fountain, its beautifully variable tones do not fight with a noisy motor for dominance. The provided motor is silent. This is also a first for me!Whether you incorporate this fountain into a larger design, place it on an altar, or run it on your office desk, you will hear nothing but the water. The design is elegant. The materials and components are high quality. I cannot imagine being disappointed by this small fountain, as long as you're aware of the size.The only thing I would add would be an inline switch to the electrical cord for convenience. But really, once you plug it in, you'll only want to stop it for cleaning, which is a breeze.I hesitated on this one simply because I had so many bad experiences with fountains in the past. This had brought nothing but joy!Some of the plants and the peacock feathers were purchased from Amazon as well.Enjoy!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Just a tad complicated
reviewText: At first I thought this was the easiest, low maintenance fountain I have gotten since normally the rest are quite an ordeal to acomodare and clean. This one is quite simple in that aspect. HOWEVER, set up was not easy and you‚Äôll have to tinker with it ALOT every time you need to clean or move anyting around to get the motor to silence. It will not be enough to just fully cover with water.The tube that came is super hard and long so you will have a terrible time cutting it until it‚Äôs exactly perfect. Don‚Äôt do it all at once because if you cut it too short it‚Äôs done. The tube is way too small for the connector so you will do quite a bit of struggling and I can definitely see how most people never get it in. Once I did I couldn‚Äôt get it out. So now it‚Äôs too long and since it‚Äôs so hard and won‚Äôt sit upright suction-cupped to the bottom as it‚Äôs meant to but instead sideways.Even when completely submerged the motor makes sound that‚Äôs louder than the splashing water so you need to continuously tinker with it and move it around until you get it to stop making noise. Unfortunately with other systems I‚Äôve had when this happens eventually there will come a time the noise won‚Äôt stop.I love the design and simplicity of this style. My concern is how long with it function accordingly.We shall see!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2012
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lovely fountain for my dresser
reviewText: I've wanted a tabletop fountain for a long time, but every one I tried seemed to spit water all over the place and get yucky water. So I really did my research before buying this one. The reviews said it does not spit water, and it doesn't. It has a nice flow from one level to another. It arrived in a box in a box arrangement, packed well in styrofoam. It was heavier than I expected. It looks like cheap plastic from the pics, which I didn't like, but the actual fountain really does look like granite, and looks and feels substantial. There is a warning sheet inside for electrical safety but no instructions on how to put together. The middle bowl has a square peg on the bottom that slides into the bottom bowl, the top then slides down over that. The pump has to be placed under the middle bowl, using the suction feet to stick to the bottom. Place the tube from the top bowls over the peg on the pump. Then make sure you fill with water over the pump. I added a drop of Fountec to the clean water to avoid the slimes. It makes a lovely flowing water noise straight from the box, no need to add rocks, etc. The pump is extremely quiet. I love to sleep to the sound of the flowing water, and my houseplants like having the extra humidity. I'm very happy with purchase and would recommend to others.(If your fountain splashes, try moving the switch on the side of the pump to a slower flow. I have mine on the lowest setting.)

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2013
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Just poor.
reviewText: This fountain is VERY cheaply made. The pieces that stack on top of one another do not fit together well and mine has always leaked. The I tried putting support pieces, gluing, balancing, nothing has really worked and the top tips water out the wrong side and misses the bowl. The finish is cheap and has peeled off almost completely and I could easily peel it totally off if I tried. It doesn't really look that great either. It looks like rock from the picture but it just badly speckled. I added river rocks to mine, which helped with the look and sound of the fountain. It sort of sounds like a toilet flushing if you leave it as is. I would spend the extra couple of bucks and buy a better fountain.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2011
reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars OK fountain, waterfall sound isn't so great
reviewText: I got this to replace the "River Bend" fountain I had in my office, which doesn't seem to be available any more. The River Bend had 3 broad lips for the water to fall over, so it produced a very pretty, soft waterfall/rainfall noise if you scattered pebbles across the lips.This bowl fountain has 3 narrow spillways. The first two are so close to the bowls that they produce no sound at all. The third sounds like a faucet running or, like one client said "an old guy taking a leak". I've put some strategic blockages in the spillways and managed to get a fairly decent sound -- one I can live with, anyway -- but nothing as pretty as the Riverbend.The fountain is quite sturdily built and easy to assemble, and I've had no problems with splashing or spillover.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2013
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Very nice, but has a slight splash
reviewText: I've had this fountain for about 8 days now. First - as reported - the bowls/pots are made out of some kind of porcelain or clay and the fountain is heavy.Assembly is a snap. The top two bowls are a single piece with a molded stem that fits into the 3rd bowl; and then the 3rd bowl has a molded stem that fits into the bottom bowl. The water hose from the pump to the top bowl is fed through the same stems. Another poster reported that the mounting was flimsy, but I disagree. Actually the stems are very sturdy - to the point to where the bowls will only fit in the one position as shown, and have absolutely no wobble.The sound of the water trickling is the best (loudest) of any table fountain that I've owned, which I expected with the large bottom bowl of water for the water to fall into. As others have mentioned, you don't hear the pump running at all.I was a bit concerned about the water level in the 3rd-from-top bowl. There's a rim around the bowl, but the water comes up to within 1/8-1/16 of an inch from the top of the rim. If someone were to knock the table where the fountain sits hard enough, I would expect some water to spill out of that bowl. This is true regardless of the pump water-flow setting (I tried all 3).My biggest issue with the fountain is that there is some splash. As shown, the bottom bowl is a big bowl full of water. I've tried various water levels from almost full to not even covering the top of the pump as well as adjusting the water flow setting, but regardless, there is a small amount of splash - with droplets of water appearing on the side of the bottom bowl and some slight specks of water collecting on the table below the fountain. After 10-12 hours of running, there's enough mist/droplets on the table to have to wipe them off. On a glass or well-protected surface, not a problem, but I wouldn't put this on a wood surface. I've also tried tilting the fountain a bit (being careful of the water close to the rim of the 3rd bowl), but I can't figure out how to get rid of the slight splash. If it weren't for the slight splash, I'd easily rate this fountain at 5 stars.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2021
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great fountain, but it would be better if I didn't have to fiddle with it.
reviewText: This fountain looks great, but I had to do so much just to get it to a place I was happy with. Obviously the pump has to be completely submerged in water to avoid the loud humming, which I did. Despite the water level, it was still extremely noisy, and I couldn't figure out why...After disassembling it completely and just having the pump plugged in by itself, I discovered that the source of the noise was coming from the pump vibrating against the base of the reservoir. Since there was no possible way to adjust the way the pump was positioned in the water, I had to resort to a very weird solution....I grabbed some pipe cleaners, shaped them into a circular fashion, and stuck them at the bottom of the fountain to make a make-shift bed to rest the pump on while it was submerged in the water, and it surprisingly worked like a charm. No more noise.Also the "rocks" that this fount comes with are absolutely pathetic. I happened to have a bag of black stones that I use for another fountain in my house that worked will for this one too.

reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cute, little fountain
reviewText: I bought this fountain for our bedroom in hopes it would drown out my husband's snoring. It has a nice relaxing trickling, sound, but alas, it cannot compete with the bear in the bed! Still, I love it. It's quite beautiful especially with the tea candles lit and the glow from those 3 tiny candles illuminates a room so warmly. My only complaint was buying it from Amazon, no sure if it was a third party issue or what, but the box it was shipped in was partially torn, the box the item comes in was really in poor shape, almost looked like a returned item resold as "new". One side of the manufacture's box was completely missing. The Styrofoam packaging within the manufacture's box was cracked and taped together. I was fully prepared to return it because it the box was in such poor condition, however, everything works, nothing was missing, and I really do enjoy this little fountain. No issues with splashing. I am going to place large rocks my husband has collected from Utah and Arizona around the base to make it even more eye appealing. I would recommend this fountain for relaxation, but it won't tackle hushing the loud snorer.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2022
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great with some modifications!
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I originally ordered this fountain to create a Zen environment since I work from home. For only $30, I figured why not? When I first unboxed the fountain, I was a little bit underwhelmed since the pieces were plastic. It comes with a small pump where you can adjust the flow of the water, the bowl portion and then the top piece (the fountain). It was very easy to assemble and the directions that were included were very clear. I played with the pump settings and found that it was most enjoyable to listen to it on the quietest setting. I know that a lot of other reviews talked about the noise, and I found a way to reduce the vibrating humming sound that the pump makes. I included a video above where you should be able to hear the flowing water, but not any annoying pump sounds. Originally, I placed the fountain on top of the wood surface and the vibrating/humming noises were pretty unbearable. I really wanted to return it. I then cut out a small piece of spongy foam and rested the fountain on top of it. This made it almost completely silent. It is extremely enjoyable for me now. It really absorbs that annoying noise. Another thing is the wire for the pump gets partially submerged in the water and I‚Äôm not sure if this is a hazard or not. I‚Äôve personally had no issues with this. This also comes with six tea light candles and some Riverstones. I added some fake succulents and a couple of crystals for more aesthetically pleasing look. I never write reviews, but this is honestly my favorite and most relaxing decoration I‚Äôve ever bought. I am hoping that this review can help some of you to make a more informed decision.I bought the 5 fake succulents on SHEIN for about $9. Great deal and it adds beautiful detail. The amount of Riverstones that they give you does not completely cover the base of the fountain, so I would suggest buying more. I found cheap ones on Amazon and at bed, bath and beyond.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect way to get the neg ions moving
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Before I purchased this I read all the reviews and I read how people jazzed it up and made it look pretty and how they kept the pump from being loud. I took all that into consideration and created mine. I ordered extra succulents and River rocks. I did put the fountain on top of some pieces of bubble wrap and believe it or not, that's a pizza pan tray that everything is on. There is hardly any motor sound. All you hear is the trickling of the water. And there you see my finished project. Remember moving water creates negative ions, negative ions create positive atmosphere and feelings. That's why everything feels so clean, lifted and happy after a good rain. Or if you're by a river or a stream or a waterfall. So get yourself some moving water. Seriously. This is very beautiful and works perfectly. No complaints at all!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2022
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love!! Took a little fidgeting but such a wonderful quiet fountain!
reviewText: I love soft nature noises. I got a Hatch for Christmas but I wanted to escape from lights and technology for a little while. I found a few fountains that I love, this was the only that arrived unbroken and while I think it‚Äôs not the prettiest in my space the sound is too great to give up! It set up so easily but I have recommendations if you get this and are trouble shooting:Make sure you use filtered water. You can buy it at a store. I had distilled water for my Keurig on hand and highly recommend that if you can get some, otherwise 32oz of filtered bottled water is what they want you to use. Distilled however is less than a dollar for a gallon in my area and the jugs are refillable at certain locations.Next I rinsed out EVERYTHING from the rocks to the base to the fountain itself to make sure dust and packaging debris wouldn‚Äôt clog the filter. Just seemed like a wise idea to me. I don‚Äôt want to return this thing or have it ruined.Next I notice some people have difficulty with the sound of the pump. Make sure you read the short quick instructions, but I also found that adjusting the fountain forward in the base and making sure the cord to the outlet doesn‚Äôt touch anything that could cause it to rattle REALLY helped with the noise, so much that there is no pump sound, unless you get up close and personal with it but sitting 2-3 feet away there is only the sweet sound of the water trickling and it‚Äôs wonderful. I have mine set to medium high and the sound is beautiful.Does not come with many rocks but I think what it does come with is nice and pretty and I don‚Äôt intend on getting more any time soon.Good luck and enjoy! ‚ò∫Ô∏è

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2023
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Not perfect, but easy, quiet, and small.
reviewText: It's served me well over the months I've had this thing. I keep it right by my bed, on my bedside desk. It's very relaxing to listen to, and fun to run your fingers through, which is the most important bit as we all know.I've read some reviews that said it was loud or made a noise. Never happened to me unless the water got too low. I'm 90% sure most of the reviews that complain about this consist of people who forgot evaporation was a thing that happens.It is understandable though, it's small, so doesn't take a ton of water for it to go from the fill line (which is kinda hard to see/find) to a bit too low and you can start to hear the difference; if you were to keep it going 24/7 I'd imagine you'd need to add water to it every 12-ish hours or so to keep 'er healthy.One complaint I do have about it is the little light that they have shining on the sail: it's a bit too bright for night yet too dim for a lit room. It's also non-negotably a part of it. You can't dim it, or turn it off while the water is going, or change the color, etc. If it's on, it's got that orange light shining at it. If you had planned on having this by your bed like me, you either have to get used to the light and be sure it's pointed away from you, or just not have it on going to sleep at all. I eventually settled on the latter.Also, the cable is a bit too short for me, just 1 or 2 more feet would've been perfect. It seems designed to go on a table or something positioned right in front of/ directly above a outlet, but the place I wanted to put it is about half a desk length away, so the cable currently is pulled all the way taught in order for it to just barely reach. The on/off switch being on the cable itself makes this problem especially cumbersome.TLDR:‚Ä¢ I like it a lot, especially for the price.‚Ä¢ It needs refilling due to evaporation‚Ä¢ Point above likely contributes most to the 'noise' complaints you may read about.‚Ä¢ Light on it is unadjustable in its brightness, color, on/off state, etc. Kinda annoying.‚Ä¢ The cable isn't very long, and the on/off switch is on the cable itself, so it must be close to an outlet with a length of the cable itself exposed and reachable.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Pleasant little fountain, but splashes if not set up right.
reviewText: As I learned, this little guy likes to splash. If you're getting a splash, consider that you may have broken one or two rules:1. Do not overfill the fountain. The water should be just below the screen mesh. Filling the water above the screen mesh will result in a subtle splash that will puddle over time. The mesh is there to break the fall of the stream, let it do it's job even though having the water up higher looks better.2. Keep the rocks off of the mesh. The fountain is covered in notes warning against this out of the box, but here it is again if you missed it.Hope this helps anyone less experienced with fountains like myself.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2024
reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars 9 months later water everywhere
reviewText: I bought this fountain in November and have used it daily. I used only Reverse Osmosis water in it, and cleaned it regularly to remove the sort of ‚Äúslimy‚Äù buildup that occurred in the base. It is now August, 9 months after purchase, and it is splashing so much water out both left and right sides that it has become unusable which is disappointing because I was enjoying it!Pros:* Easy assembly* Nice appearance* Didn‚Äôt require daily refilling (only about every third day)* Pump was quiet* Fairly loud water sounds. You could hear the water sounds in other rooms. This could be a pro or a con depending on what you‚Äôre wanting.Cons:* No adjustment on pump. Maybe my pump arrived broken, but there is no way to adjust the strength of the flow, so it was only high. This meant‚Ä¶* Splashing. No matter how I tried positioning rocks, or removing them altogether, this fountain left splashes around it, particularly on the left side. **This got significantly worse over time.*** Loud water sounds. I wanted more of a ‚Äútrickling‚Äù sound for relaxation purposes, and this was definitely stronger than that, again because the pump lacked any way to adjust the flow strength. This didn‚Äôt stop me from enjoying the fountain while it was functioning properly, it just wasn‚Äôt my preference.If this fountain hadn‚Äôt become so splash-y, I would have rated it higher. As it is, though, only giving 9 months of use, I don‚Äôt believe it gave good value for the money I spent.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2022
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars How It Really Sounds
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. As you can tell in my video, the fountain does not sound like the product video. I have it on medium flow, which is my favorite setting after trying it on high and low. I wasn't expecting it to be so light, or for the bowl to be (thick) plastic. This isn't necessarily a bad thing; both look good, and the bowl is nice and large, and it holds plenty of water to not drop much in level in 24 hours in my dry climate. The way the blueish lights dance off the water is pleasant and makes the fountain into a nightlight. The pump suction-cups to the bottom of the bowl and is much quieter than the water - it makes a low-pitched hum, which is easy to hear when the fountain is on the counter or the room is dead silent. You can feel the bowl vibrating slightly. I'm not getting tired of the water sound after using it constantly for several weeks, though I do have it plugged in to an Alexa plug do I can turn it off with my voice while watching a movie. The power connections to the light cords inside are totally secure and waterproof. I haven't measured the change in humidity, but I can feel a significant improvement in the humidity levels in my apartment - I've even gotten used to leaving the bedroom door open at night and sleeping to the sound of it. Topping it off with filtered water in the morning is easy to do. Recommended!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2022
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars üíßüíßüíß Very nice table fountain üíßüíßüíß
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Wonderful. Good trickling rivulet sound. We took a few sprigs from the artificial Bonsai trees to add a few "bushes" and have played around adding various rough crystals. No splashing as is, but if you add stuff it depends where you place it. Lots of room to sort of design and create your own Zen waterfall üßé‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüßé‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüòå Fun!The pump is very quiet, but a vibration was created with the supporting table. A folded towel underneath quieted the buzzing some but not completely, but by adding three small prism stones directly underneath the bowl to create a tiny tripod of sorts the buzzing vibration was eliminated completely, so now there's just the sound of the water, which can be slightly varied by stone placements. This table is on wheels, a more solid table might not have this sound vibration issue.One serious drawback in design is that, although having a water flow adjustment is a nice optional control; it is located directly on the pump. So if you want to change the speed of the water flowing, you have to completely remove the top cascading rock design off the bowl to adjust the slider on the pump, which is very awkward.Not being able to turn the lights off is another drawback, but we just put stones over them to cover and block or soften the light intensity. Also depending on the transparency of the crystal you can modify the color shade of the light.The material looks like real rock.Very happy and satisfied with this.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2016
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars ... arrived a few days ago on time and in perfect condition. It looks exactly like the picture and ...
reviewText: My tabletop fountain arrived a few days ago on time and in perfect condition. It looks exactly like the picture and is quite lovely and serene. It is very quiet unlike some where all you can hear is the pump. When Im still and quiet I can hear the water softly flowing. I have not been able to get the pump to stick to the bottom. Hard to explain, but you have to tip the top part with the buddha on it forward if you want to stick the pump to the bottom, but when you do that it doesn't reach. If you do not put it all the way forward you cannot get your fingers in enough to push the pump to the bottom. I think there needs to be an opening on the top part behind the buddah where you can get a finger or two in to push the pump to the bottom. To much work for me, I just let it float as is and it works fine. Also, you may want to fill it with water and adjust the pump before you put the top part on. I filled mine with water put the top on and filled it with some small pebbles I had. When I turned it on the water splashed onto the tabletop. Not really a big deal because its glass but if it was wood or anything else it could get damaged. So I turned it off, took out the pebbles and the top with the buddha and adjusted the speed on the pump. It works great now. I have put it on every night for the last week and I enjoy it very much.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2017
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very Nice but Could Use a Couple Things
reviewText: OK -Then. I just layed electrical wires under water and I'm not shocked. Nice! Sure hope the wire coating lasts a while or it's lights out.-Alright, now, the good and bad. It does look good and it works just fine. The bad is that their are no real step by step instruction with this. Their needed and I'll tell you why. The pump has a slide controller on it to regulate the flow of water. Did you even know that? If you look on the side of the pump, it's the little lever there. But, this is not explained anywhere. Also, the tube that puls into the bottom of the buddah, is too short and I could not secure the pump with the suction cups because it won't reach the bottom, so it just floats. But, this too is not explained. There are not many parts to this but a video or some written instructions are needed. If anyone has a problem, let me know. I'll help you put it together. The light bulb needs to be plugged in real good or it will fall out, and their hard to find. Because there is no on/off switch on this, (there should be), I ran a extension cord to a switched outlet. Now, when I shut off the main lights, this turns off too. So, good fountain for the money but the makers need to add:1. step by step instructions or post a video2.make the intake tibe longer3. supply extra bulb

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2017
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A lovely fountain that looks great in my office
reviewText: This is a beautiful fountain at a great price! It looks fantastic in my office along with my zen garden. My friend added a couple of polished stones to make it look extra cool! It was easy enough to set up (you‚Äôll need a small Phillips head screw driver to adjust the lamp). The instructions were lacking (pictures only), but I didn‚Äôt find it difficult. I would prefer an on/off switch, but it‚Äôs not a huge deal. I just flip the switch on the power strip when I go home for the day. Keep in mind that there is a lever on the pump to adjust the water flow. I had it on the lowest setting at first (thinking it looked like that was the highest) and I couldn‚Äôt hear the water like that. It‚Äôs a perfect flow on the highest setting with the switch turned all the way up and no splash off the sides as long as you have the rocks positioned right. I love this fountain!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2017
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars ... time I got this for myself it was so easy to assemble
reviewText: The first time I got this for myself it was so easy to assemble, came with all the pieces, looked great once done.Recently my mom got diagnosed with cancer, so I ordered it to bring it back to her in Canada. Once we got to Canada and i started assembling it, I realized the main connector piece that connects the light bulb to the body of the plug was missing. What results is that the water will still flow, but we can never tell when the thing is plugged in because the light isn't connected! So basically it is usable but not really.This is extremely disheartening especially since we don't live in Canada and fixing such a SMALL problem will take a VERY LONG TIME. It's so frustrating too because this was meant to be a gift for a cancer patient who actually takes the whole buddha idea very seriously, especially since now she has so little certainty in life and so much to be afraid of.Needless to say I'm EXTREMELY ANGRY with this company for missing that tiny little piece. If something can be done to fix my situation I'd be extremely grateful.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Peaceful & Serene Water Fountain!
reviewText: This water fountain is a fantastic addition to any office or living space to provide quaint background noise and aesthetic pleasing!The build quality is great! I ran the pump continuous for 24 hours to make sure the pump ran great with no issues. From there, I let it continually run the majority of the day. The lights are bright enough in the dark to notice them, but not overbearing. Additionally, the power cord is a USB connection with a USB wall plug, so that provides some flexibility in terms of plugging in the unit.I opted to provide additional rocks to the unit to mitigate splashing. The addition of rocks allowed the water to roll off of the flower pods right onto the rocks and worked great. Make sure to read the instructions to fully understand the operation of the fountain.Finally, I want to commend the seller on the packaging of the unit. The packaging was very thought out and provided security to the unit during shipping.All in all, a very quality product to increase overall comfort and peacefulness within a space.

reviewDate: Reviewed in Canada on February 11, 2023
reviewTitle: Nice Looking - Can be Loud
reviewText: Liked the look of this desktop fountain and it runs well. However not currently able to use it as it is too loud for my studio space due to the design and water drop back into the pool. I'm in a 12 x 12 room, albeit with a lot of hard surfaces (floors, walls, desks) so the water sound quickly moves from soothing trickle noises to reverberating distraction. To spin the ball the pump has to be on the second highest setting only. Anything less and the ball stalls or only vibrates, high speed, the water shoots off the back of the ball and on to desk and floor. It looks nice in our decor, so I kept it and have the LEDs lighting the ball without the pump and may rig it in the future as an atomizer to create a fog illusion in the centre design. It just doesn't work as intended in my office space - may be great in a different setup and if the limitations of my environment are removed, it's worth the 4-stars. Disappointed I can't use it in my space and so not advised for a smaller quiet office area or where lots of impromptu Zoom or Teams meetings are frequent unless you can unplug it easily / quickly. Sounds to remote users like you're in the bathroom, LOL!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Took some tinkering, finally got the sound I was hoping for
reviewText: I purchased these as it hit my two main criteria for work office decor, it was cheap and not terribly tacky.I wanted a quiet sound of running water in my office, the noise helps me focus. I was disheartened initially as it was nearly silent, and by nearly I mean it didn't even so much as produce sound other than the hum of the pump. I noticed upon assembly that it hard some sort of black plastic restrictor inside the hose that runs from the pump to the top bowl. I used a tool to remove this restrictor and that massively improved the flow. It now generates a delightful trickle!Not featured in the listing are the included small pebbles and glass marble ball thing. The instructions make no mention of placement for the marble in the feature, it only fits in the top ball. I assume it is to create the effect of the ball spinning or bobbing. However, it is far too heavy an merely acts as yet another restriction for flow. This is OK as with the pump turned to full with the restrictor removed it is a little aggressive, but slower speeds lead the pump to more hum.All in all, it balances itself out nicely. It produces the sound I was looking for and the design isn't terribly obtrusive.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2023

I‚Äôm glad I did as there were some plastic shreds. The pump has four settings. It seemed to have some noise as the slowest setting, but I‚Äôm using the highest. It‚Äôs very quiet overall. If it started to make some some vibrations, I‚Äôd wiggle the cord to adjust the location of the pump and it would be fine. Not having enough water would cause noise too.Is far as a trickling sound, I never seemed to get one. I tried the different pump speeds with and without the rocks. reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2022
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect! Easy to assemble!
reviewText: Take the LED light piece and slide it through the pipe, then connect the water pump to the end of the pipe. Only the water pump should be touching the water. Make sure to fill the container ALL the way to the very top but before doing so, apply the rocks to your liking so that it wont add weight to the water flow. Give the fountain a second to push the water through and IF you do not fill the fountain all the way to the very top, the ball wont spin and the water wont flow and it will also cause it to make a very loud weird noise. Hope this helps!!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2015
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very attractive/works great
reviewText: I bought this to replace my circa 1998 concrete 3-tier table fountain, which I was using to put a little moisture in the air in the kitchen, where my houseplants are growing. I stumbled upon this fountain, and chose it because it looks both gorgeous and as if it would take up even less room than my old table sized fountain.Got it, unpacked it, it was a breeze to put together. It has an on/off switch on the cord, which is so much better than having to unplug the unit entirely. It gave off a lot of mist , the colors are a beautiful, rich shade of green-aqua-blue....And unfortunately, there should have been a red color as well . A few of the tiny bulbs were out.The item was otherwise working so well that I really considered just keeping it, but I ultimately decided to return the defective model and replace it with the same product. But then I discovered that Canary has, for the same price as this unit, an otherwise identical model with a remote control! So I bought that one, which arrived today.The new unit was up and running in about 2-3 minutes flat, all the colors are working great, as is the remote, there's 16 different color features for blending colors, having only one stationary color ,having no color, 9 different mist settings....Unfortunately, there is no green color. This one is blue-red-yellow, not blue-red-green....And the green on the other unit really was a gorgeous shade of deep emerald, especially when it was running in an otherwise darkened room.Sigh....I have tried to give the cons (no remote, no green) and the pros (everything else!) about both units. A remote is great, but an on/off switch on the cord is still pretty darn convenient. Both are quiet, colorful, and give off a lot of mist. According to my pocket humidity tester, these units raise the moisture in the air percentage in their proximity from 39-40% to 44-45%. No idea of exact range, but I have placed my unit in the middle of a large credenza, on which I have 10 herbs in pots growing. I believe it has enough range to cover that space, and the tester seems to confirm this. Hopefully that'll be enough to keep my poor plants happy until they can go outside again.I highly recommend either model, and I will probably wind up buying that floor stand model for the living room. The plants in there deserve a little more moisture too. :-)

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2016
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I like the product
reviewText: I like the product . It looks beautiful and it works!!!! I almost give up on it and returned .... I assemble the fountain and plug in and it didn't start... Only lights works so I thought is broken send back to oryginal seller from canary asking for replacement. I revive it in 5 days as they promised . And hooked up again the mist maker . I use tap water as they ask and nothing again !!!! I had direct Number to one of the menager and was able to get in touch with John who actually was kind and nice and explained me problem with water chemistry ! I add some shells to tap water to help the water get some more minerals and leave the fogger over night and day . Evening I put on and works perfectly thanx again !!!!

BUT the next time I filled it, it began to leak. Maybe a cork would have worked better. TOTAL WASTE OF $!! ...unfortunately, it's unusable... But it was very cool and pretty at first. I never write reviews, but in this circumstance, I wanted to warn other people about this issue. Terrible design, poor quality...Seriously, they've got to know this doesn't work, so why don't they fix the problem?

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great company to deal with
reviewText: Received and set up was easy. Worked right off and has a pleasant sound. Lights are bright and at night create an interesting light pattern. After running for two days, had some issues. Lights were dim and pump barely moved water. If I disconnected the lights the motor ran fine. Reconnecting the lights, had bright lights that dimmed and motor loss power. Instead of trying to box item up and return it to Amazon, I went on Alpines Corporation web sight, and made a warranty claim. I filled in the claim form and sent it electronically. In my email I restated what had happened. Within two days (on a Saturday) I received a response from a customer service representative. She, right off, processed my claim and offered to replace the lights and pump. Within five days of my initial inquiry the parts were shipped. Through UPS. I received them fairly quickly, UPS had a delay. Everything works well and I am happy with the product and Alpine Corporation. They stood behind the product and sent me the necessary parts to have it working again. I highly recommend the product and the company. The representative was very polite and attentive to my issues and quickly resolved the matter.Again, this is a nice table top fountain. It is pleasant to watch and creates a relaxing atmosphere. I am going to use it in a vivarium. It is made of good quality. There were some pieces that rattle in side, left over from manufacturing, but were easily removed.I highly recommend the product and the Alpine Corporation.

reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I love the way it looks. I like the water sound. The only problem is that the sound of the pump motor is just as loud as the water trickling. I like the fountain enough that I'm tempted to just buy another motor, but the thought of taking it apart and trying to install a new one makes me cringe.11/5/22 Update. I've had this in my office since the purchase for no other reason that I've not had the desire to bother with another motor. I have used it on and off since then. I've had to knock this down to a single star, though. The main reason is leaking. It's leaked a few times now. The leak split my $50 wood tray that I bought for the fountain. I can glue that, so it's not that big of a deal, but it's frustrating. See attached photo. You need a flashlight to look into the reservoir to be able to see at what level the water is at. There is no marker so you really don't know if you're at the right level or over the level. This just isn't worth the hassle. It looks great, but the functionality is subpar at best. I've decided to try a fountain that has a separate reservoir where I can simply lift the fountain off of the bowl when needed and can easily see the water level. This fountain is a single moulded piece with a tiny sliding door in the back that you can't even fit your entire hand into to reach the motor. I do not recommend this product, unfortunately.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2017
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great fountain - perfect!
reviewText: I love this fountain - the look of it is attractive and gives a peaceful feeling. It provides just the right amount of water sound - not too much or too little, with NO splashing! The pump is extremely quiet, at least most of the time - it occasionally makes a little bit of noise for a while, I'm kind of assuming it may suck up some bit of debris on those occasions, because it's so quiet the rest of the time - virtually can't even tell it's running. As mentioned in other reviews the LED lights are bright, but that is easily remedied by a few well-placed rocks (a previous separate purchase), to cover or divert the light. I do like the light once the rocks toned it down, it definitely adds to the fountain. The only 'negative' I can post is that it's a little awkward getting to the pump, etc., since it's all self-contained within the fountain, but it's doable and I don't know how else it could be handled other than if the fountain had a bowl under it that the pump rested in, but of course that would give it a bigger footprint and it's a nice compact size as is - not too small, not too big. No complaints, very happy with my purchase and would definitely recommend it to others!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2022
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful Fountain. Instructions need work. See below if you have difficulty during setup.
reviewText: As I find happening more and more these days, products that arrive work exactly how they should but due to instructions that lack proper detail the setup is often frustrating and may even dishearten you enough to return it. The customer can even find themselves thinking they have a faulty product when in reality the instructions skipped over something that could solve the problem. Some times you may feel a little "stupid" when you realize where you messed up but let's just assume that you have no idea how ANYTHING works. So here are the few things that, if you have never owned a fountain before and have precisely no idea what to expect (which is what instruction manual writers should always be assuming when considering wording, what explanations should be included, and visual aid. Think of that instructions giving exercise you might have done in school during which you give step by step DETAILED instructions on how to make a peanut butter and jelly sandwich.), this is what you need to know.First. Have several towels ready. Put one down, put the fountain on top of it and be prepared to switch them out. Put a bowl of water under the table you have the fountain it on if you have to. After I write this I will be blow drying the carpet.In regards to the following steps.3. Check that the pump is firmly connected to the water tubing that is built into the fountain and the pump is sitting flat on the bottom of the reservoir.A bit of clarification: The pump and the water tubing are not actually connected already. However, because everything is packed in so tightly it gives the illusion that it may in fact be quite secure. There are warnings all over the place that if you damage the tubing your warranty is voided which gives the customer a sense of uncertainty about handling the pump at all. And of course you can't actually see anything in the reservoir so that isn't helpful. Also getting the pump to stay flat while the reservoir is dry is more trouble than it's worth so keep reading.Side note: There is a small grey slider on the pump that determines the strength of the flow. Make sure that is all the way on. Because it didn't seem to mark which way to slide it (there is a good possibility it is in fact marked however when I figured this part out the pump was inside the fountain already), keep this in mind for the bit of troubleshooting clarification at the end of this review.5. Fill the fountain with enough water to keep the pump fully submerged during operation, approximately 6 cups.Note: The image above the worded instructions shows the water being dumped into the bottom pool where the light is located. Don't do that. There is no way to truly feel or see if the pump is actually submerged. Get a funnel, make sure you have a good light source angled towards the back of the fountain (where the access panel door is meant to go once setup is complete. The panel should not yet be in place.) With the pump pushed in as far as possible but NOT holding it down, fill the reservoir, slowly, by pouring the water into the funnel first. Once the pump is submerged as much as it can be , remove the funnel, reach in and push it down gently, ensuring that the suction cups on the pump are properly secured. If the pump is now sticking out of the water, reinsert the funnel and add more water until the pump is submerged.Note on the note: At the bottom it states "Note: When first plugged in, there may be air in the pump. It may take several moments for trapped air to escape, allowing water to flow."When it says several moments, it means it. I'm not saying two or three seconds I'm saying give it a good thirty before deciding that the flow may not be strong enough.And on that note on the note, the troubleshooting I mentioned. If it seems that the water flow is terribly weak but it's clear that the water is not being backed up (the pool at the bottom isn't overflowing therefore proving that the problem is most likely not kinking or a break in the tube) reach back in and feel for the pump. Feel for that grey slider and push it in the opposite direction. The flow should immediately increase. This just means when you slid it over the first time you slid it in the wrong direction. If the flow DOES NOT increase, check again that the tubing is secured to the pump properly. Though I found once it was, it didn't slide off easily.About the visual aid.I can't even fully explain what is depicted in the little bubble next to the image of the fountain. There is a square pointing towards a line that has another square protruding from it and what looks like a chord dangling out of it? I couldn't tell you what that was supposed to signify other than don't have this thing plugged in when dealing with water. But it could also be referring to the light splitter which is used to, as I'm sure you've guessed, split the power so the pump gets the proper voltage and the light gets the proper voltage without needing two separate AD wall adapters. But because it isn't clear, that can put some doubt in your mind as to whether or not you're missing something.Concerning Troubleshooting SectionThere are an abundance of troubleshooting steps listed with this product. They are basically just for if the pump doesn't work at all. I mean it doesn't even turn on. There was almost nothing about if the product functions but not as expected. That is why I was fumbling around so much and figured out the little tip about the slider on the pump. A troubleshooting guide should essentially be worded like "If this is happening make sure that this is secured/plugged in/properly positioned etc. Not the case here.In conclusion: The fountain is wonderful. It does exactly what is shown in the video in the description. It sounds great, looks great, and is extremely soothing. I would love to fill my house with these or even get a floor standing one just to have more of that atmosphere in every room, but alas I live in an apartment (with a landlord who, let's just say, deserves his own written review. I'll do that in the proper venue once I've moved out.) But the instructions are poorly written. As I said. All manuals should be done assuming the customer knows nothing. This may seem like a useless review to someone who had prior knowledge, but to those of us that literally have no idea, it will help you.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2019
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I Love This Fountain!
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. This fountain has a beautiful and natural-looking design and a quiet but strong pump. I have the pump set at roughly the middle speed and it is perfect for me. The water noise is super relaxing, but loud enough to be prominent in my bedroom. I sleep about 9 feet away and cannot hear the pump from that distance (I can barely hear it even 3 feet away if I listen closely for it). I have trouble getting to sleep, but this has helped a lot. I now look forward to turning on my fountain and relaxing when I come home from work. This is one of those items that I wish I bought years ago. It is expensive, but well worth the money. I have only two minor complaints besides the price (which, to be fair, seems in line with comparable fountains): the lack of an on/off switch and the fact that there is only a light on one of the levels. But those issues hardly detract from how much I like this fountain. I only had it for two days, so I can't speak to longevity, but it has made quite the positive impression and I feel confident it will last long. I will try to remember to update the review in a few months.I attached two pictures and one video. While all of them show the fountain with the light on in a dark room, one video and one photo were taken with the flash on so that you can see the whole fountain (the vertical video is deliberate because of the shape of the fountain, but I am typically against vertical video). The other photo was taken without the flash and shows what you would actually see in a dark room. Amazon does not allow us to upload two videos or I would have also uploaded the video taken without the flash.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2021
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Flawed Design - Water eventually pours out
reviewText: This is my 2nd Sunnydaze fountain. The first works great and doesn‚Äôt splash or dump water out. This particular fountain has a fatal design flaw - when the water level gets low through evaporation, the water cascading to the bottom level bounces back up and out of the fountain. After waking up multiple times to a soaking table and floor, I decided to try various water levels to isolate the problem.My findings - the bottom level where the LED‚Äôs are is concave in shape. When the water level is shallow enough to allow the water to pour onto the concave surface, it bounces upwards and out of the left side of the fountain. I placed a small rock in the bottom atop the LED‚Äôs to break up the water flow which did work for the low water level condition. Alternatively, when the fountain is full, there is a tremendous amount of splash out which also soaks the surrounding area.These flaws destroyed a piece of wood furniture and also damaged my wood floors.To top it off, the seller doesn‚Äôt accept returns.It‚Äôs a beautiful fountain but should only be used outdoors where water won‚Äôt cause damage.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2018
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So glad I bought this tabletop waterfall
reviewText: Despite the mixed reviews on this product, I ordered it and am so glad I did. It arrived with a gash in the box, but the item itself was well insulated and didn't have any damage. The water flows beautifully - the lights are delightful - and the pump is quieter than expected - you can definately hear the bubbling waterfall over the pump hum. The pump did seem a little louder for the first 24 hours, but it seemed to quiet down a bit after that (or I just got used to it and am now able to focus on the sound of the water flowing over it)! Becareful not to overfill it though. I filled it to the max line when I first got it and it ran beautifully for a week - no spills, no splashes. However, the water did appear a little low so I added water to it, but apparently I added too much and for the next 2 days it splashed and leaked a little, but once the water level went back to "normal" it's been fine since. I am usuing it in a busy grooming salon to help occupy the focus of some nervous clients that sit and wait for their pet to be groomed. It is very calming and helps add a sense of tranquility to the shop. Kids find it pleasing to look at too! I even added a few drops of aromatherapy to the water to add another layer of relaxation through scent to aide our most anxious (human) clients! I would HIGHLY recommend this tabletop waterfall.

reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Leaks with loud pump!
reviewText: I read the reviews and had high hopes for this fountain, but it fell way short of my expectations and I am returning it.At first, it was a bit loud, but I made sure to add water so that it covered the pump and it could still be heard over the running water, but was not as loud as it first was. Still, it's not something I would want running in my room at night because it was not whisper-quiet as the drinking fountain my cats have. I know that it is POSSIBLE to make an economical pump that isn't loud. The makers of this fountain might want to check in to that.I could deal with the loudness by placing it in the dining room or living room, but the final straw was that it LEAKED. The leak was somewhere in the base, because that's where the water was pooled. The sides were dry, so it wasn't leaking from the sides, but the bottom was soaked. There were no visible marks that it was leaking from, but after unplugging it and picking it up, water just seemed to seep out of some unseen source and drip from the bottom.I didn't expect too much from a 55 dollar fountain, but I wanted one that didn't leak and had a pump that was somewhat quiet. This did not live up to my expectations and is being returned.

reviewText: So the product was great until it wasn't.. After a few months the pump had stopped to a trickle.. Before tossing the pump and ordering a new one, I gave it one last clean.. While doing that, I found, shoved up in the hose line, was a cut piece of it, to restrict flow (see pic).. My guess is after a year or so you figure the pump gave out and it's time to buy a new one.. Well it's not, I shoved a screw driver up there and got it out.. My fountain works like brand new again and I have a feeling itll stay working like new üôÉ.. Im not gonna say, when it was new, MAYBE it needed the cut piece of tube to restrict the flow, so it wasn't to much, BUT it ended up ruining it almost.. reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2017
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lovely little fountain
reviewText: Really enjoying this pretty fountain. Other reviewers found the pump to be loud, but ours is very quiet. The sound of the water falling is more noticeable than the sound of the pump, which is just a very low level of "white noise". We had one issue, but fixed it with some trial and error. The directions say to set the pump at maximum volume, which I did. However over the course of a day the unit leaked out much of its water. Upon close inspection I could see that it was losing water from the bottom pool due to some excess overflow at one low spot in the rim. We thought about building up the rim there, but couldn't think of an aesthetic way to do it. So I pulled the pump and experimented with flow levels. The lower setting was too low, and made the water barely trickle through the pools. But the medium setting was just right, creates a good waterfall but doesn't allow excess water to build up in the bottom pool.Whenever it starts to "whisper" a little, indicating low water levels, I just pour a cup or two of water in and it's been working fine.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Elegant, quiet, ball no spinny
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. This is a very simple, yet elegant looking desk waterfall/fountain. It's also not exactly what I was looking for, before i really knew what i was looking for.It is extremely simple to put together (basin, pump, fountain base, water cups... and the decorative rocks and glass ball).However, when I assembled, filled, and ran it, I found two things that weren't to my liking:1. It was almost silent. I was expecting some amount of flowing water sound as soothing background noise but there was none. I tried removing the glass ball from the top cup to increase flow but everything is too close to the next recepticle to generate any noise. If you want visual aesthetic with no sound, this is your fountain.2. The ball doesn't spin much/at all. Other reviews recommend adding water but that is not a silver bullet. I tried filling it to almost overflowing and draining it to just enough to keep flowing, no spinny.So I tried some configuration changes to try and improve the glass ball visual aesthetic and provide some flowing water ambience. After a little trial and error, I came. up with the following, as shown in the pic and vid:- Remove the bottom (LED holding) cup. This allows the water to drop from the third cup straight into the water basin through the hole where the last cup should be.- Place the LED in the runoff hole of the fountain base in front of where the bottom cup goes.- Place the glass ball on top of the LED to help obscure the space where the last cup should be.- Lay the rocks around the fountain base, using 2-3 to help build up the 'wall' hiding where the water flows into the basin.This will not give you a spinning ball but it will light it up and provide some subtle background trickling water. You're welcome.I don't usually expect to have to hack something to suit my requirements but this fountain is elegant and cheap enough that I didn't mind.

reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Has some flaws, but it works and it's cute
reviewText: I'm like 90% sure that the unit I received was used/returned because there were water marks on the pieces. I don't really care about that but thought I'd mention it. The gripes I have are that there is a hairline crack across the back side of it and there are some glue spots/flaws in the finish. I'm sure the crack can be sealed, and it's in the back so no one will really see it. The glue spots are likewise fixable.The fountain is easy to set up. You just attach the tube to the pump, set the pump volume with the little lever, pour in your water, place the top piece onto the bowl, press the pump to the bottom of the bowl so the suction cups stick, arrange your rocks, plug it in, and you're off to the races. The pump is quiet and easy to replace if necessary.It makes a nice setting for action figure photos (just don't leave them there or the water might damage them) and can be decorated adorably with colorful glass pieces/beads, non-water-soluble minerals (such as quartz or obsidian), or little glass or ceramic fish/frogs/turtles/birds/etc.Note: in my photos, I have the pump set on medium (the lever is right in the middle)
