reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2018
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Bad cable location. Very nice design, relaxing, some mod work required for cords leaking.
reviewText: Purchased 2 of these to place on opposite sides of my 220 gallon South American Cichlid Aquarium. I must say they blend in nicely and give the ends of the tank that curb appeal it had been missing! I also purchased some fake ivy from a different seller to add to the area as well I will try and link that item. So now on to what seems to be the common thread and only a few people have figured out about the leaking etc. Dealing with very large aquariums and numerous water fountains and other water features I am very aware of how and where many leaks come from, short of there actually being a crack or hole in something water will always find those little unthinkable ways to escape. It appears the leaks are caused by the outlet area for all the cords! As most people will just let cords do the natural flow. There are a min of 4 cords coming out of the back. The solution I found that works is get all the cords together zip the them in 3 places, get some water safe silicone and silicone the rounded out area that is located in the lower left of the pump access door. Then place all 4 cords against the silicone then add a bit more to ensure the cords and fountain are covered with it. I then just installed the pump cover purposely pushing into the silicone to form a seal around the cord area. Using a small 3m adhesive strip/hook I then looped the cords up the back just to make sure water if any would not follow that path. I can tell you this stops the mystery leaking. The cords inside the fountain get dripped on by the led lights especially if the seals for them are not tight. Water then flows along the cords and out causing the leaks! Should consumer's need to do this? Absolutely not but that is what needs to be done! I only put theses in 10 inch planter bottoms to add black rock to match my Aquarium. Overall the water volume is nice and pump is quiet. Shimmering lights effect it gives off is also relaxing. I have found no splashing with these fountains. Having these on timers they run about 16 hours a day I average about adding water once a week that is lost through evaporation!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2019
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 15 Month Review + Tips
reviewText: I've owned this for 15 months. It's been in use almost seven days a week the whole time, often longer than 12 hrs a day, once for 24+ hrs just to see. I bought it to bring life to my small home where my pets are alone for way too long. It's still working like it's brand new and looks that way too. I only clean it monthly and do that by using really hot water and the kitchen sink sprayer along with my finger to check for sliminess inside and in the pools. I've used vinegar but not sure if it made any difference. Other than that, I add a microbe treatment for general protection, available from Amazon: Ecological-Labs-10TTFC4-Microbe-Fountain which is supposed to be safe for people and pets. I know my little ones drink from the fountain and 15 months later everyone is still okay. TIPS: Keep it level to help avoid splashing and possible leaking. Keep it relatively clean to protect the motor and any little ones that will drink from it. Keep it in a 12 inch plant pot or similar pan to catch potential leaks, then make that look pretty. Added benefit of using a plant pot - portable nature scene if you'll need to move it around. Use only mineral free / distilled water (not spring or municipal) to prevent mineral build up that can mess up the motor and discolor the fountain. Fill it directly in one of the pools. So much easier. There is a rim / lip on the lowest pool that you can fill it up to. Any more will get you a mess. This is the amount I filled it to and got over 24 hrs use one day** BUT NOT IN THE HEAT OF SUMMER! Don't let it run dry or the pump will be damaged and likely not work anymore. Takes approximately 1 1/2 quarts to fill, maybe a little more. That's not exact but real close. Get a storage bin: doubles for coverage if it needs to stay semi-outdoors when rain or heavy winds are expected. Mine stays on the porch in the summer and uses more water due to evaporation. The motor is almost soundless. All I hear is the water falling into three pools. Beautiful sound and beautiful to look at if it gets doctored up a bit. Improves every place I've put it in, adds life, comforts my little ones, sort of makes a regular room feel like a destination, and everyone who sees the fountain comments on it. If this dies I'll get another one in a heartbeat.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2019
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars If you take the time to set it up right, it's wonderful.
reviewText: Read Jeff Thompson's review. He talks about how to set up the cords and silicone the opening to make sure you don't get leaks. It takes a little work, but once you get it set up correctly, it is really wonderful. I also agree with the buyer who said it pumps plenty of water at the lowest pump setting. I took their advice and I'm glad I did. It pumps quite a bit of water at the lowest setting. The lights are perfect, the sound of the water is amazing. I really like it. Here's a few tips: 1. Put it in a container in case it leaks. 2. You can fill the water from the front so seal the bottom part of the back opening with silicone (see picture). 3. The lowest point of the back opening is about 3.5 inches from the bottom. So if you fill the water from the front, get the level to where the water just covers the LED light in the lowest basin. That is about 3 inches from the bottom so it won't be overfilled and the water won't leak out the back. 4. Use a water treatment that is meant to stop bacterial growth and mold. I use one that is meant for swamp coolers and humidifiers. 5. Like others have suggested, use small rocks at the base of each waterfall to change the sound to fit your preference. 6. I took out the black screen on the second tier waterfall because I didn't like the way it looked. After I took it out, I didn't notice any difference in splashing or the flow of water, so I would recommend doing that. I just want to give another special shout-out to Jeff Thompson. I don't know you, but I'm very grateful for your idea on stopping the leaks! I took the time to write my suggestions because Jeff took the time to write his. Overall, after taking the time to get it set up right and making a decorative base for it, I absolutely love this waterfall! It's so relaxing and peaceful. I'm so glad I got it.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2022
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful and Quiet Feature That Only Needed One More Thing
reviewText: I bought this for my wife to place next to her Orchids, thinking it would add a little moisture to the ambient air around them. I was very impressed with the quality, and the easy setup. It is important to note that you need to make sure the pump is completely submerged. Anyway, the LED's are awesome but why not put one in every tier?? There are 4 tiers but only 3 LED's. It just looks like it is missing that forth tier and seems like it could have been such an easy thing to include. This is the reason for my 4 stars instead of 5.I will fix that 4th tier by adding an LED to that location. There are many aftermarket parts to make that happen. Other than that, it's a wonderful table top feature that works great with a surrounding of plants.ADDITIONALLY: I am normally not happy with about 25% of my Amazon shipping experiences, but this time, I have to say that I am completely happy! I did not think I would get this until at LEAST 5 days later, yet it got to me in two days. THANK YOU! Expected Feb 17th, got Feb 12th!EDIT: I changed my review to 2 stars out of 5. Why? The pump croaked after less than 5 months of use. I figured it would die with continuous use in a year or two, but not after less than 5 months. We only used distilled water, used the water anti-algae drops weekly as-per instructions, and NEVER let it go dry. As a matter of fact, because of evaporation, I checked it every day to make sure it was full. So since it croaked, I decided to do to it what I wanted to anyway. Put an after-market pump in it, and redo the LED feature. After all, I was always irritated that not all the tiers were lit.EDIT 2ND: The customer service is very good. I had a response to my complaint email within one business day, and had a pump shipped and received within 4 business days free because of the warranty. Our feature is working great again, which is why I bumped the rating back to 4 stars.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Sound, well made, could easily put in New water pump if needed.
reviewText: Beautiful sound like water over rocks in a stream to me. Is well made. Lights are not so bright you can't run it and go to sleep by it. You can also buy a few glass rocks to put over them to dim them if needed. Easy to set up. My concern was if I could ever easily replace the water pump if it went out and from what I can tell in the inside of the fountain you can. Just get a new one likely online or from the advice of their customer service people. The user Manuel it came with didn't match the fountain style but the set up is pretty easy. You just plug in the power cord silver attachment to the cord end match inside the back of the fountain. But not yet to an outlet. Then add water so the pump is covered completely over the top of it with water and there is enough for the fountain in general. I put my fountain in a deep tray first so if I blew it in water amount it would catch it. Then PLUG in the fountain for it to come on. Water flow speed is on the side of the small water pump inside the back of the fountain. Then once I was set, I drained the extra water off of the tray I had to keep the fountain dry on the bottom. The only bad thing on this fountain is it doesn't have an on or off switch for it only the plug. So I like to use what I call a tack strip or a multi outlet strip and surge protector with an on or off switch on it. It works fine so far long as that is all I keep on that strip plugged in.

reviewText: The media could not be loaded. It‚Äôs easy to set up, the pump is quiet, and the sound is relaxing and loud enough to be heard across the room.Water level and cord placement has a significant affect on pump noise, so if yours is too loud make sure it‚Äôs as full as possible (without overflowing) and/or try moving the cord around until you find the quietest placement.Rock placement has a big affect on ‚Äútrickle‚Äù sound. If you don‚Äôt care for the sound you‚Äôre getting try rearranging the rocks under the flow of water.The only drawback is that there‚Äôs no on/off switch on the fountain or cord - it has to be plugged in every time to turn on and unplugged to turn off. This seems to be standard for these little tabletop fountains. I solved this problem by using an Amazon smart plug and controlling it with Alexa.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome!
reviewText: Not perfect but then you wouldn‚Äôt expect it to be for the price. Seller was nice. Don‚Äôt expect to have the water falls fall in a perfect V shape forever. They might but mine didn‚Äôt. But I tell myself it looks more natural this way, like it would fall in cave. Lights are still working months later. Really warm color, nice at night, relaxing sound. Big tips: place this fountain on a piece of foam like you find in some shipping boxes, or another vibration absorptive material. The fountain gave off a hum when I first placed it down, but after putting a layer of foam between it and the surface, it is silent now except for the water sounds which are relaxing. Hooked it up to a smart switch, can control with my voice! Very cool. Also be sure to have a bottle of water you keep full nearby because whether due to evaporation or splashing, water does leave this thing at an alarming rate, so expect to top it up once a week or so if you‚Äôre using it regularly. Got a sand crystal on top of mine ‚Äî I call it my Sun Temple. Reminds me of Mayans. I know I also have good taste in cars. Enjoy!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The motor is very quiet.
reviewText: Likes:The motor is very quiet, it looks really nice, it works well, the added pot for a small plant is cool, the price is reasonable (paid $40 for it), the power cord is decently long, water doesn't splash.Dislikes:I really don't want the light on and there is not a switch to turn it on and off. I'm pretty sensitive to light. It's a small light but even if I just look at the fountain for a few seconds, not at the light itself but just the fountain in general, and look at something else after, I can still see that light. It'd be nice if there a switch or if we could dim it or have different colors for it. When I have more time, I'll have to figure how to disconnect the light adapter.The only other detail I don't like is that you have to unplug the electrical cord from the outlet/power strip to turn it on and off. I'll probably end up attaching it to a smart plug to control it on and off without having to routinely unplug and re-plug it. The power cord could've been made so that it was two pieces with an on/off switch so that 1) You can easily turn it on and off without having to plug and re-plug and 2) When it is time to clean and/or refill, it would be easier to disconnect and reconnect.Preferences:The water could be louder, which is the reason why I got it in the first place -- the sound of water is very calming to me and genuinely makes me feel happier; but that's a personal preference and not on them. I'll probably experiment with some small stones to see if I can get the sound a little bit louder. If you try the same just make sure that you're careful to not block the hole, are mindful of possible splashing and mindful of not overfilling the water tank.Additionally, if you do not plan on using that spot made for an actual plant, you can use different colors of dye to change the color of the water. That's also another reason why I think it would be cool if we could change the light color so it's not just white; at least made it amber. White is just a boring light color for a product like this. Now that I am thinking about it, dying the water a different color could also lessen the light as well.Overall:5/5, easily. It's easily a good product for the price and do recommend. If it had been more, say around $60, I would've given it a 4 due to the power cord and not being able to adjust the light by turning it on and off. Regardless, I would've still recommended it anyway. I also like that I was able to get it with Prime quickly. Also a really good bonus üëç

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful and noiseless if you make the effort. NOTE: NO CUSTOMER SUPPORTt
reviewText: Lovely little item, truly.I don‚Äôt understand why people complain about the water noise or splashing, all you have to do is place pebbles where the water pours and then no more noise or splashing.Leave top bowl (level 3) alone.Leave middle bowl (level 2) alone, place one of the larger rocks where the water from this bowl hits the platform.Bottom bowl with light (Level 1), if you want to remove the sound where water from level 3 drops into the lighted level 1 bowl, place a rock leaning against the orange light in the bowl where the water from the level 3 bowl lands and that will stop the splashing sound.If you line up the pebbles against the edge of the platform you will also cut down any noise from the motor.You can top off the water by pouring it into the little hole in the back, where the power cord is supposed to come out of the water pump.... so you don‚Äôt have to remove the platform to do that. However, it is tedious to once a week clean the item. You have to remove the pebbles to fully clean it and then have to replace them when done. If you use clear not hard water, you can clean it every few weeks rather than once a week..NOTE: Make sure you run it hard during the first few weeks so if there is a pump problem, you can return it to amazon. I did wind up having a pump issue and THEIR CUSTOMER SUPPORT DOES NOT RESPOND TO EMAILS.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely Beautiful!
reviewText: I understand that reviews are subject to individual perspectives and experiences so I keep that in mind whenever I am buying a product. This beautiful fountain checks off just about all the boxes for me. When it first arrived and I looked at the size of the box I thought to myself, this is really small. However once I put it together and on top of my table, it was absolutely perfect! I received all of the items new and in prefect condition, there were no broken or missing pieces. While it came with instructions it really wasn't necessary, it was so very simple to put together and it took me less than 3 minutes and I had the water flowing and everything working. I was grateful to the reviews that mention using distilled water instead of tap water in order to prolong pump life, so I bought and added distilled water before starting it. I was looking for a fountain that could give me gentle water sounds, that did not have that spinning orb (as I don't like them), that had the soft glow of yellow warm looking led lights and a quiet pump. This fountain had all of that. The only downside was it does not have an on/off switch, but a lot of them don't and I don't mind connecting and disconnecting the fountain. This fountain is just as beautiful and peaceful sounding in the day as it is the night. I can't predict how long it will last as I've only been running it since I received it 4 days ago in increments of a couple of hours in a 24 hour period, but so far it's perfect. I have the peaceful water sounds and no motor sounds. They include a bag of rocks to go around the base, I tried them in different locations till I got what for me was the perfect water sound, as you can see they're scattered around the base with a few of them piled right under where the water flows from the last bottom bowl. I look forward to morning and evenings when I go out to my back porch to look at the plentiful wildlife and listen to the relaxing sounds of my fountain. I love this fountain so much, I will most likely get another one for my meditation corner.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2023
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice little fountain
reviewText: If you don't mind it splattering a little bit, this is a nice fountain. It's a case of the pump not quite being matched to the capacity of the fountain, so you will want to turn it to the minimum speed. Also, a couple of things that aren't mentioned in the instructions... It may seem strange, but your electric cable for the LED light will be underwater. Just be sure and screw the connector on tightly to help it be waterproof. Also the purpose of the sponge isn't mentioned. It shows where the sponge sits, but doesn't say if it's only for packing, or meant to be there while operating the fountain. I found the sound so disagreeable if it was in place while the fountain was operating, that I pulled it out.From past experience with fountains, you will want to follow the advice of cleaning it every week because mold will probably build up in the reservoir just above the water line. Also, even though I use distilled water, there is enough stuff in the air, that eventually slime will start to grow in it if not cleaned regularly.If you keep these things in mind, you will have a very pretty, gurgling fountain to grace your table.

I will have to move it from beside my desk because I can't crawl under the desk every day .Other than these small inconveniences, this is a lovely fountain and so peaceful. It makes me smile and quiets my heart watching it.All in all, it's a good purchase. I would give this item as a gift as well.

reviewDate: Reviewed in Canada on November 24, 2023
reviewTitle: An Attractive and Relaxing Water Fountain
reviewText: This indoor tabletop water fountain is attractive and relaxing. The fountain comes with a pump and crystal ball on top. The fountain looks beautiful with four tiers made of stones and a bottom layer to recycle the water. The fountain was simple to set up, taking minutes to assemble, and began working after adding water and plugging it in.The LED light adds a nice ambiance, but it's just one colour. The addition of a clear, glass ball on the top tier creates a mesmerizing effect as it spins with the flow of water, reflecting light beautifully. The pump operates quietly in the background. On the downside, it is a bit pricey for a small tabletop fountain. Overall, I would recommend it to anyone looking for a charming and relaxing water fountain to add to their home decor.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A fun fountain!
reviewText: My child had been asking for a desktop fountain and after looking at many options, he chose this one. The rolling ball is really cool, especially since it is lit up from below. The fountain came with good instructions, which made for easy set up. The mister is really cool to watch, but results in the whole counter getting wet as the mist settles, which is a little bit of a problem since ours is sitting on a wooden bookshelf. Luckily the mister has a separate power source, so our solution is to just turn it on for a little bit and then unplug it. The fountain is well made and worth the price. The motor is not noisy and the trickling of water is a nice ambient sound. My child often turns it on before bed and falls asleep to the sound.One more comment - the picture shows what appear to be live fish in the fountain. This fountain would definitely not be a good long term home for fish. reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Strong Pump. Easy to clean
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. My previous solar fountain died when it was just over one year old. I looked at the reviews for several of the offerings by Amazon and chose this one mostly because of its simplicity and low price. I was pleasantly surprised by how easy it is to disassemble for cleaning. Unlike most of the others, it is possible to remove the rotor from the pump motor, thus enabling it's cleaning as well.The pump is quite a performer! It produces a stream around three feet high with the single opening tube. The problem with that is the fountain must be refilled several times a day if there is any wind. I found that using just the straight tube with no attachments provides plenty of water motion and limits water loss to that caused by evaporation - and what the birds splash out! I suspect that all that power could produce a more attractive display in a larger fountain.I have only had it for a month so cannot testify to its longevity, though I suspect it will exceed those without the motor disassembly feature.The majority of the accompanying video was shot on an overcast day. That makes it appear as though the cleaning did not have much effect. I assure you, it does. The pump does require strong light to work. As can also be seen in the video, it just kind of burps in low light. In fact, it sometimes stops completely when the whole surface is shaded. That is OK for my purpose, which is mostly to provide water and bathing for the birds without worrying about mosquitos.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Simple But Cool Little Gadget!
reviewText: We bought this to squirt water into the air in our bird bath in an effort to cool the H2O (Florida, temp right now 98 degrees and increasing). It squirts great! For a simple and very inexpensive little gadget it does its job perfectly. NOTE that it does NOT charge its battery (if it even has one?). It takes electricity from the solar cell and uses it to IMMEDIATELY pump -- no sun? no electricity and no pump! But, hay, what do you want for under $15? It does need sun, not just light so not so much pumping at sunrise and sunset (certainly not at night!). Oh Yeah, when its really hot, the temp of our water is still somewhat warm so our great idea of using the fountain to cool the bird water was somewhat of a bust. Ain't science a kick?

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works well, really reasonably priced.
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. So an update about eight months later. For $10 I didn‚Äôt expect them to last that long, so eight months is about what I expected. I went with a little different solar model that has the bubblers instead to see how those work betterSo just an update after owning it for a couple months and it continuously being on in my 30 gallon horse trough. I‚Äôve only had to scrub out the trough once in two months from algae. Prior it would be at least every 10 days. Pretty amazed at this little item. As others have stated, this does not have a battery where it retains power overnight, but for 10 bucks what do you want? Long as it has light and it doesn‚Äôt even necessarily have to be direct sunlight, it works to some extent. I keep it on medium to low where the fountain works just well enough so the water is not stagnant. Buying another one for my other animal water trough. I‚Äôve read were others have had issues with it getting clogged, as long as you keep as long as you keep contaminants out of the water you will not have that issue. The only time I got clogged is when there were some algae in the trough that I needed a scrub it out, a little bit got in the water holes. Very easy to clean out, just took a stiff plastic brush and poked it in the little holes and it was good as new. Wiped off the solar ‚Äúpanels‚Äú and worked as well as the first day. I don‚Äôt think this fountain has the rating it should have overall, I‚Äôm sure there are some duds out there just like there is in any other product but for $10 I really do like this item. I think too many people are expecting it to store like a battery to charge for overnight. Again it‚Äôs 10 bucks.So I was a little skeptical about this little solar fountain for $10 being all that. I was surprised though, it actually had power coming out of the box. I use it in my 30 gallon horse trough not a birdbath, just enough oxygen into the water where the algae won‚Äôt grow so fast. In the video I have it on medium flow. It does require sunlight obviously being solar, but even when it‚Äôs cloudy, It‚Äôs given about half flow. so far very impressed , well worth a $10 investment

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great Little Fountain
reviewText: Works great in my birdbath! I wish the 4 centering pegs were attached better, I took off one star for that - some large birds ended up removing them from the fountain and I had to look for them in my yard a couple times. There isn't a good way to glue them on either. Some of the reviewers mentioned this product stops working - and I did experience that a couple times when the birdbath went dry. I brought it inside, cleaned the filter material, and then took it back outside in the sun where I had to shake it quite a few times vigorously until I could feel it working again. As long as the birdbath had water, the product worked well when the sun was out. Another note: I could only use the downward flowing fountain attachment, all the other attachments caused the water to shoot outside the birdbath. But that was fine - I just wanted water movement in the bird bath, and this did the job.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great little solar powered water fountain for bird baths!
reviewText: This solar-powered fountain works great in my pedestal bird bath -- it does need direct sunlight to function well. When the sun rays are coming at an angle, the motor will work intermittently. With direct rays, the fountain sprays quite high (greater than 12 inches). To decrease the power of the spray, I put a very small rock on one panel section and it worked perfectly to bring the water spray down to 3 or 4 inches. Just enough to attract the attention of birds, but not enough to cause water to splash out of the bird bath.Tip: Clean out your bird bath every evening, give the fountain pump a rinse and allow to air dry (solar panel side down) and refill bird bath with fresh water in the morning. This will prevent mosquitoes from laying eggs in the water, plus keeping the water fresh and clean prevents the pump motor from clogging up.I have had my fountain pump over 2 months now and it is still working just fine.

The only thing we don't like about it is that the water always splashes outside of the container which means you end up having to fill up the container a lot. Unless you have it inside a very large container that I will catch the water. Also if there's a bit a wind it will cause the water to spill out causing your container to run out of water. So I gave it 5 stars because it does work good as long as there is sun and the water remains full. Not something to leave out if it's windy or more more than a couple of days.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2022
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Cool Concept But......
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I really like this solar powered bird bath fountain pump. It works really well in direct sunlight. Let's get to some pros and cons of this solar fountain pump. I will try to include a video and some pictures. Pros: (1)-Works great in constant direct sun. (2)-No batteries needed. (3)-Its gorgeous and the birds loves it. (4)-It comes with everything you need including 5 different water spray nozzle patterns & plastic straw like support beams to keep it centered in the middle of the bird bath which keeps it from moving around. Cons: (1)-The water splashes everywhere especially if it's windy outside. (2)-You will need to refill the bird bath bowl with water every few hours because the water dissipates from the bird bath really quickly. The reason? Refer back to con #1. (3)-It was a little pricey but I would buy this again if I had a large fountain or a pool in my backyard. (4)-These solar fountain pumps is ideal for a pool or a large fountain because the water will deplete every few hours in a very small bird bath like the one I have in my backyard. (5)-Must have direct sunlight for it to work. No sunlight üåû no working fountain. They are fun to watch, but just make sure you put it in a pool or a large bird bath or water fountain if you don't want to refill a small bird bath fountain bowl every few hours. Truthful & unbiased review.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Outsized enjoyment!
reviewText: We wanted a small bubbler fountain to keep near a hummingbird feeder on our deck, but we lacked an electrical outlet nearby. I had my doubts as to whether the solar fountain actually would work, but it works really well whenever there's sun. It kind of spurts in stutters, or slows to a very low burble, when the sun is obscured by clouds or trees, and as the sun approaches the horizon, but no matter; the water flow has been enough to make itself known to the birds and squirrels in our yard. The squirrels use the fountain regularly, and it has been fun to watch them trying to figure out and trust the fountain, as it "dims" whenever a squirrel bends its head over the fountain to take a sip. They've figured it out and trust it now. For us humans, the sight and sound of flowing water is a pleasant, cooling addition to the "deck experience."We put our solar fountain in a 12" Hanizi Deck-Mounted bowl (also from Amazon), which is the PERFECT size and configuration for Mademax fountain. The solar fountain works as a plain burbler if no flow attachments are used. However, 4 easily-changed attachments are included to change the flow/fountain pattern. We are backyard bird-watchers, and have been for 5 or 6 years now. We'd always heard that a fresh, flowing water source was the most effective way to attract birds to one's yard -- even more so than bird feeders. We've always kept a clean bird bath available, but it holds still water, as a fountain in the bird bath would get continuously clogged by bird droppings, leaves, and feathers. Perhaps it was merely coincidence, but since we added the solar fountain on the deck (which is visible from the sky and the trees in the area), we've greatly increased the number of birds coming to our feeders. Doves are the only birds that actually drink from the fountain (probably because the proximity of humans keeps other species away), but the flowing water is like billboard to passing birds that our yard is a promising dining spot. I replace the water in the fountain every morning, and it needs to be refilled midday (we live in the very hot SE U.S.), but the deck and fountain are right outside our kitchen, so that's no problem for us. We were snickering at ourselves for even considering a solar fountain, but have commented to one another quite a few times how glad we are that we got the Mademax fountain and Hanizi bowl.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Powered entirely by solar , it reduces the need for electricity.
reviewText: I recently purchased the AISITIN 3.5W Solar Fountain Pump for my outdoor DIY water feature, and I am thoroughly impressed with its performance and design.Installation and Setup:Setting up the AISITIN solar fountain pump was a breeze. The package includes everything needed to get started, including several nozzle options to create different water patterns. The instructions were clear and straightforward, allowing me to have the fountain up and running within minutes.Performance:The 3.5W solar panel provides ample power to keep the pump running smoothly, even on slightly cloudy days. The pump has a strong and consistent water flow, creating a delightful sound and visual effect in my garden. I appreciate that it operates silently, adding a serene ambiance without any distracting noise.Design and Durability:The design of the AISITIN solar fountain pump is both functional and aesthetically pleasing. The solar panel is compact yet efficient, and the pump itself is sturdy and well-built. It has withstood various weather conditions, including heavy rain and wind, without any issues. The included nozzles allow for customization of the water flow, making it easy to change the look and feel of the fountain.Eco-Friendly:One of the standout features of this pump is its eco-friendliness. Powered entirely by solar , it reduces the need for electricity. This feature also means there are no running costs, which is a significant bonus.Value for Money:Given its performance, ease of use, and eco-friendly design, the AISITIN 3.5W Solar Fountain Pump offers excellent value for money. It has transformed my garden into a more inviting and relaxing space, and I am confident it will continue to do so for years to come.Conclusion:Overall, I highly recommend the AISITIN 3.5W Solar Fountain Pump for anyone looking to enhance their outdoor space with a beautiful and functional water feature. Its ease of installation, reliable performance, and eco-friendly design make it a fantastic addition to any garden or bird bath.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Strong Pump. Easy to clean
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. My previous solar fountain died when it was just over one year old. I looked at the reviews for several of the offerings by Amazon and chose this one mostly because of its simplicity and low price. I was pleasantly surprised by how easy it is to disassemble for cleaning. Unlike most of the others, it is possible to remove the rotor from the pump motor, thus enabling it's cleaning as well.The pump is quite a performer! It produces a stream around three feet high with the single opening tube. The problem with that is the fountain must be refilled several times a day if there is any wind. I found that using just the straight tube with no attachments provides plenty of water motion and limits water loss to that caused by evaporation - and what the birds splash out! I suspect that all that power could produce a more attractive display in a larger fountain.I have only had it for a month so cannot testify to its longevity, though I suspect it will exceed those without the motor disassembly feature.The majority of the accompanying video was shot on an overcast day. That makes it appear as though the cleaning did not have much effect. I assure you, it does. The pump does require strong light to work. As can also be seen in the video, it just kind of burps in low light. In fact, it sometimes stops completely when the whole surface is shaded. That is OK for my purpose, which is mostly to provide water and bathing for the birds without worrying about mosquitos.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Replacing my first one, this one is smaller and I don't like that.
reviewText: I had one just like this and it worked great for several years. The solar part got a white film and eventually it wouldnt come off. It still worked until the little motor stopped working. This one is too small for the pot I use for my fountain. I don't like it.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Simple But Cool Little Gadget!
reviewText: We bought this to squirt water into the air in our bird bath in an effort to cool the H2O (Florida, temp right now 98 degrees and increasing). It squirts great! For a simple and very inexpensive little gadget it does its job perfectly. NOTE that it does NOT charge its battery (if it even has one?). It takes electricity from the solar cell and uses it to IMMEDIATELY pump -- no sun? no electricity and no pump! But, hay, what do you want for under $15? It does need sun, not just light so not so much pumping at sunrise and sunset (certainly not at night!). Oh Yeah, when its really hot, the temp of our water is still somewhat warm so our great idea of using the fountain to cool the bird water was somewhat of a bust. Ain't science a kick?

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2024
reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars FULL sun required, birds say NO
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I gave this product 3 stars because it does work as the description states. However, I regret the purchase and do not recommend unless you live in a place that is always sunny.- The fountain will not work unless it is in FULL sun, hence, it will not work in the shade of a tree or an overcast day. I added a video to show what it does on a cloudy day, it gurgles. The fountain doesn‚Äôt charge like some of my other solar items. I wanted to put it right under a tree branch for the birds because they prefer to come down for a drink and fly back to a tree for safety. I‚Äôm unable to use the fountain as I wanted.- If the sun comes and goes, the fountain does too. The water will spurt out the top.- I did appreciate the little plastic straws that help keep the fountain in the center.- The water has to be at least 2 inches deep to allow the fountain to work. If working as stated, the fountain will shoot too high and it ends up splashing water out of the birdbath. Maybe it would work better with something deeper than what I‚Äôm using. I‚Äôm constantly having to fill up the bath.- My birdbath was a happening place until I put the fountain in. Enough said.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2024
reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars The good & the bad
reviewText: This fountain is powerful (like the Texas Sun where I am)! I didn‚Äôt have any cloudy days when I tested it, sorry. I‚Äôve no complaints on the powerful spray itself. Creates a nice pattern, and there‚Äôs plenty to choose from. Easy to assemble and choosing a spray is easy and fun, using the glossary and testing it out.* note* the fountain works instantly! That‚Äôs great, but it also doesn‚Äôt store energy, so no spray at night (or I assume on dark days). For all the above I give it 5 stars. However, here‚Äôs the problem I couldn‚Äôt overcome:This is a free floating device. The spray moves it around the birdbath, and it inherently stays next to the side, causing half the spray to land outside the birdbath until it drained all the water! I tried fixing the gizzy to various items, but never was successful. Maybe something could be epoxied onto the birdbath for gizzy to be adhered to. For you crafty types and for this cheap price, maybe you can figure it out. I gave up and put my St. Anthony statue in the birdbath instead.

reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars 100% direct continuous sunlight needed
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Ok so does it work? Well if you take the description for it's word then No, because it is not stable in sunlight. Read the copied description below. Watch my video just shade from your hand or something moved close to it and it stops working. To me stable in sunlight means it's stable in daytime light! If you ever get a cloud forget it, it's not gonna function! If you live in the desert or put it up on your roof lol then maybe unless you to can have a cloud or touch of shade.Description :Stable and Durable: Larger 7.1 inch diameter solar panel cover to transfer stronger power to make fountain spray more lasting and stable. It get fast to work automatically once it put in water with sunlight.Take away:Stable,durable, sunlight, the key word's used in the description, but I don't read 100% direct sunlight used anywhere! The one star is fair as it does come on, but can't say it work's as advertised by a long shot a loose meaning of sunlight because one could argue that you can't have daylight without sunlight, but it does not work in just normal daylight even on a clear day and 80 degrees.

Also very easy to clean when debris get sucked into the pump. Will be getting a couple more in the spring.

reviewText: The media could not be loaded. 2nd Update- I looked up how to fix these little fountains. Took it apart and removed debris. Put it back together and it immediately started working. Took about 5 minutes to fix it. Just flushing it wasn‚Äôt enough.Update-this little fountain stopped working after two months. We flushed it out and it still didn‚Äôt work. Soaked it in a vinegar solution and brushed it out. Still didn‚Äôt work.This is a great little solar fountain for the price. We have had it running for over a week now. When the sun is on the fountain, it‚Äôs on. When there is no sun, the fountain is off. We had some difficulty putting on the four stabilizers, but just stuck a rock in the bowl of the birdbath for birds to perch on. We do seem to have to fill up the birdbath more frequently, which isn‚Äôt a problem. I hope the fountain lasts a long time.

reviewText: There were so many options when I was shopping for solar fountains for my birdbath, all had a range of ratings and this one was priced right, so I decided to just order it! There's almost no assembly (mainly deciding how you want the water spray by selecting one of six nozzles), it started right up, and the strong flow almost emptied the birdbath immediately. In the meantime, since it needs to be in the sun to work, the birdbath needs cleaning more often, and one can just spray off the intake part of the fountain too.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A+ Bought mine in July 2022!!
reviewText: I live in the Coachella Valley. Summers here are brutal with temps from 110+ on average. The picture window where the fountain sits in front of gets the full brunt of the sun for most of the day here. But this little fountain has survived one hellish summer so far and then some! (If my fountain could talk! ü§îüòÜ) It is still running much to the delight of my kitty who loves to study it while she's waiting for a lizard, bunny or a bird to pop by. I placed my fountain outside in a somewhat shallow plastic recepticle that I got at the 99¬¢ store. Nothing fancy. So here are some longevity tips that work for me and will probably work for you.Keep plenty of pure water in your recepticle. Be sure to keep an eye on it during the day to make sure the water stays at an optimum level. Water levels go down because of evaporation and water being splashed either by the action of the fountain or wildlife playing in it. I just keep a hose or water container close by to quickly refill it. Clean the motor periodically depending on use. Keep your recepticle clean. Can't stress that enough. That means scrub it clean bcuz of slime/dirt buildup. If you've placed the fountain in a birdbath, you also need to scrub out the dirt and slime impurities often. Don't neglect this important step because it totally helps with the overall function of your solar fountain. Also clean your device. I can't stress that enough either. I take a power nozzle and spray the entire underside of it and gently swipe off any slime or dirt with your fingers to get around and under the tubes and motor housing on the underside.. And Yes!! You can power nozzle the motor. It blows out dirt and slime!! I do it all the time. I also do a periodic vinegar cleanse to it. Fill your recepticle with water. Stir in approx 1/4 cup per gallon of water. Use basic plain vinegar (acv, white. Do NOT use any other kind of vinegar) put your cleaned fountain in the water and let it run in the sunshine for 2 days. Maybe longer if you get less full sunshine. After 2+ days, dump the vinegar water, rinse device and power wash the underside again as little round gel like formations may have grown underneath, then add clean water again, add the device and set it in the sun again. It will be like new. The vinegar clears out scum and calcium buildup inside the device which causes a flow reduction or just stops working altogether. I do this once/mo usually or when I see my fountain struggling to work.There are no switches or controls. The solar motor is all it needs. And with some love and attention it will live a long time. I love my fountain. But I bought it for my indoor kitty and I think think she loves it more than me üòÇ

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Powered entirely by solar , it reduces the need for electricity.
reviewText: I recently purchased the AISITIN 3.5W Solar Fountain Pump for my outdoor DIY water feature, and I am thoroughly impressed with its performance and design.Installation and Setup:Setting up the AISITIN solar fountain pump was a breeze. The package includes everything needed to get started, including several nozzle options to create different water patterns. The instructions were clear and straightforward, allowing me to have the fountain up and running within minutes.Performance:The 3.5W solar panel provides ample power to keep the pump running smoothly, even on slightly cloudy days. The pump has a strong and consistent water flow, creating a delightful sound and visual effect in my garden. I appreciate that it operates silently, adding a serene ambiance without any distracting noise.Design and Durability:The design of the AISITIN solar fountain pump is both functional and aesthetically pleasing. The solar panel is compact yet efficient, and the pump itself is sturdy and well-built. It has withstood various weather conditions, including heavy rain and wind, without any issues. The included nozzles allow for customization of the water flow, making it easy to change the look and feel of the fountain.Eco-Friendly:One of the standout features of this pump is its eco-friendliness. Powered entirely by solar , it reduces the need for electricity. This feature also means there are no running costs, which is a significant bonus.Value for Money:Given its performance, ease of use, and eco-friendly design, the AISITIN 3.5W Solar Fountain Pump offers excellent value for money. It has transformed my garden into a more inviting and relaxing space, and I am confident it will continue to do so for years to come.Conclusion:Overall, I highly recommend the AISITIN 3.5W Solar Fountain Pump for anyone looking to enhance their outdoor space with a beautiful and functional water feature. Its ease of installation, reliable performance, and eco-friendly design make it a fantastic addition to any garden or bird bath.

reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A+ Bought mine in July 2022!!
reviewText: I live in the Coachella Valley. Summers here are brutal with temps from 110+ on average. The picture window where the fountain sits in front of gets the full brunt of the sun for most of the day here. But this little fountain has survived one hellish summer so far and then some! (If my fountain could talk! ü§îüòÜ) It is still running much to the delight of my kitty who loves to study it while she's waiting for a lizard, bunny or a bird to pop by. I placed my fountain outside in a somewhat shallow plastic recepticle that I got at the 99¬¢ store. Nothing fancy. So here are some longevity tips that work for me and will probably work for you.Keep plenty of pure water in your recepticle. Be sure to keep an eye on it during the day to make sure the water stays at an optimum level. Water levels go down because of evaporation and water being splashed either by the action of the fountain or wildlife playing in it. I just keep a hose or water container close by to quickly refill it. Clean the motor periodically depending on use. Keep your recepticle clean. Can't stress that enough. That means scrub it clean bcuz of slime/dirt buildup. If you've placed the fountain in a birdbath, you also need to scrub out the dirt and slime impurities often. Don't neglect this important step because it totally helps with the overall function of your solar fountain. Also clean your device. I can't stress that enough either. I take a power nozzle and spray the entire underside of it and gently swipe off any slime or dirt with your fingers to get around and under the tubes and motor housing on the underside.. And Yes!! You can power nozzle the motor. It blows out dirt and slime!! I do it all the time. I also do a periodic vinegar cleanse to it. Fill your recepticle with water. Stir in approx 1/4 cup per gallon of water. Use basic plain vinegar (acv, white. Do NOT use any other kind of vinegar) put your cleaned fountain in the water and let it run in the sunshine for 2 days. Maybe longer if you get less full sunshine. After 2+ days, dump the vinegar water, rinse device and power wash the underside again as little round gel like formations may have grown underneath, then add clean water again, add the device and set it in the sun again. It will be like new. The vinegar clears out scum and calcium buildup inside the device which causes a flow reduction or just stops working altogether. I do this once/mo usually or when I see my fountain struggling to work.There are no switches or controls. The solar motor is all it needs. And with some love and attention it will live a long time. I love my fountain. But I bought it for my indoor kitty and I think think she loves it more than me üòÇ

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works!
reviewText: Good value for the price.Using this for a bird bath so it has some caveats for this purpose.....It comes with plenty of nozzlesPROS-Lots of options to choose from with the spray tips included.-Easy plug-n-play setup.-works great as long as in DIRECT SUNCONS- even without the extension and with the shortest tip, for my 2" deep, 12" round bird bath it will still spray over the radius. Therefore, I have to keep an eye on it and refill throughout the day so the little motor doesn't burn up from running dry.Tip: since birds like to carry seed with them, I had to add a mesh fabric around the body to prevent tiny seeds and debris from going through the intake. Without it, the smallest particles would make it all the way to the tip, block a hole, and cause the spray to go rogue- not just N S E and West but throw in a random NNW at a 20 degree angle and out of the bowl.I still consider this a good value because it works as stated, just nothing fancy. No lights. No nighttime Bellagio fountain show in the backyard but birds like it.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2023
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice Little Bird Fountain BUT...
reviewText: Pros: It works nicely. So far seems to have a good power for it's size. Has the perfect spray for a bird bath. Birds are loving it. I'm honestly not sure what people are complaining about parts not fitting??? they may have gotten a different model or were missing a piece??? Everything went together easily for me. It's got a nice size spray so you're going to want a pretty decent size bath or the overspray may drain your bird bath quickly.Cons: The solar panel needs SOLID direct sunlight. In the summer heat, I prefer to keep the bath in the shade to keep it from getting too hot. Gave it a 4 because I would preferred the cord to be longer so I can keep the bath under the tree and the panel in a part of the yard that's full sun. The cord is not bad, just not long enough.Note: Niether pro nor con...The panel does not have battery storage. When the sun is gone, the pump stops (I knew this before purchase). This does not bother me at all since the birds don't normally "bathe" in the dark.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice basic little pump
reviewText: This cute little solar pump was just what I wanted. Something small and inexpensive to keep the water moving in a little birdbath dish out in the backyard where there is no access to electricity. It is as advertised, very basic, without even an on/off button. This is NOT the type of fountain that charges up a battery and then works consistently. If the sun is shining directly on the solar panel, it works. If it is very shady or at night, it does not pump. It comes on an off and varies in intensity according to the sun. The birds are happy, the water stays clean longer, and the sight and sound of splashing water is soothing. There are no real instructions, but once you figure out the "puzzle" on the box showing the various combinations of the spray heads with or without the extender/riser you will certainly find a combination that works for your own little fountain. I am using it without a spray head, just the short extender pipe since the water pan I have is rather small and it was spraying out of the pan with the spray heads when the wind blew. With the no-spayhead option, it looks a little like a drinking fountain. Picture attached. I like it very much.

It comes with a bunch of different nozzles but we actually fitted it with a straw to use in our makeshift bird bath and it worked perfectly! There was zero setup, just out of the box and into the water. Sun came out and it started flowing. The only downfall is on cloudy days or in the shade from a tree, it doesn't run consistently so if that is an issue, you may want to consider one that has a battery built in as well. Cannot complain at all for the price though üê•üí¶

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2024
reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Great while it worked, 2 months!
reviewText: This pump worked very well, so well in fact that I couldn't use a spry head or it would blow out the water with the slightest breeze. I took off the head and it worked fine. Then, one day I went out and there was almost no flow. Ok, I guess I need to clean the sponge filter. I did so, reassembled it, and ........nothing!This is a great pump if you need it for a few weeks for a special occasion, but otherwise, no dice. Too bad as the solar panel is large and worked well. All I NEED IS Q NEW PUMP, not the tubing or solar panel, but I can't buy just the pump. I've purchased this two times and no bueno either time. Ok, I tried one last time to clean it.I brought it in and removed the sponge filter, yes, it is nothing like the picture to clean. You can't remove anything except a small piece of porous sponge. I removed that and cleaned as much as I could, then took a toothbrush to the "frame' that holds it, and when I put it back together, voila, it worked again. So the solar collector is great, the pump is meh, and the filter system is the weakest link. I anticipate cleaning the sponge filter about two more times before it falls apart. Without it, the particulates will get sucked into the pump, causing failure since you can't get to the pump motor. I know this is not a 1/4 horse pond pump but a little better filter, or cleaning access would go a long way to the longevity of this pump! I'll change my star level from 1 to 2.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on June 2, 2024
reviewTitle: Surprisingly good.
reviewText: I have tried a fair few solar pumps before and thought as the price was so cheap I wasn't going to lose much by giving this a try. Worked perfectly in a garden water feature, the suction cups keeping the pump in place are very strong. There is a variety of fountain attachments to try. The lead from the pump to the solar panel is long enough to go from the water feature and then be attached to the top of a 6ft fence to capture more of the sun. Obviously if the sun isn't hitting the panel then the pump won't work as there isn't a battery back up. But for the price I thought it was better than I was expecting. Ideal for a small water feature or bird bath.
